question:
In light of the recent announcement about mandatory hallmarking of gold jewellery, consider the following statements:
  1. Gold jewellery can be sold only in the caratages of 10, 18 and 22.
  2. Gold artefacts of 14 carats can be sold without hallmarking.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The ministry of consumer affairs had recently announced that gold jewels and artefacts cannot be sold without hallmarking. The jewellery will be issued only in 3 caratages with the hallmarks- 14, 18 and 22 carats. The hallmarking is done by the Bureau of Indian Standards.    Statement 2 is incorrect: The centre has announced that the earlier practice of issuing 10 grades of gold will no longer be continued. Only the 3 caratages of 14, 18 and 22 carats will be continued. If these are sold without hallmarking, the seller will invite penalty of up to 5 times the cost of the object and even imprisonment.
